description.narrative: The objective of the Urban Water Supply Project for the Democratic Republic of Congo is to increase access to water in selected urban areas and increase the efficiency of REGIDESO (State Water Utility Company - DRC). There are two components to the project. The first component of the project will improve and expand water supply services in major urban centers. This component will be carried out through investment and rehabilitation programs specific to Kinshasa, Lubumbashi and Matadi. The investment programs funded under the project will mainly improve water production capacity, improve the distribution system and finance individual connections and collective distribution systems. The second component of the project will support to sector reform, capacity building, and improved governance. This component is designed to contribute to the sustainability of investments funded under component first and will help achieve operational and financial viability of REGIDESO. This component will also: (i) contribute to the sustainability of investments funded by other donors in the sector; and (ii) enable REGIDESO to initiate rehabilitation in other centers across the country using cash generated in the profitable centers, and therefore proceed to the extension of water provision in cities which are not benefiting from the investments under component first.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, A-1 | Description :Subsidiary Agreement between Borrower and Project Implementing Entity underterms and conditions approved by IDA | Due Date :31-Jul-2009
Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, B-4(a) | Description :Establish Local Steering Committee | Due Date :30-Apr-2010
Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, C-1 | Description :Recruit Private Operator under Management Contract | Due Date :30-Jun-2010
Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, C-2 | Description :Management Contract must be duly authorized or ratified. | Due Date:31-Aug-2010
Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, C-4 | Description :Performance Auditors Contract signed by COPIREP. | Due Date :30-Sep-2010

Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, C-5 | Description :Technical and financial review of Management Contract carried out byPerformance Auditors and report submitted to Oversight Committee. | Frequency :Quarterly
Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, D-2 | Description :COPIREP to submit Staff Restructuring Plan to IDA for review and approval. |Due Date :28-Feb-2010
Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, D-3(a) | Description :Carry out Retrenchment Payments through Intermediary | Due Date:31-Mar-2010
Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, D-3(b) | Description :Carry out audit of Retrenchment Payments by Auditors. | Due Date:30-Apr-2010
Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, D-5 | Description :COPIREP to conduct survey of Staff Restructuring Plan outcomes | Due Date:31-Oct-2011
Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, E | Description :Prepare and submit plan for carrying out sanitation strategies in Lubumbashiand Matadi. | Due Date :30-Apr-2012
Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, F | Description :Tariffs structure and costs recovery plan submitted to IDA including actions tocarry out communication strategy. | Due Date :30-Apr-2012
Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, G-1(a) | Description :Carry out inventory of PIE assets and liabilities and submit FinancialRestructuring Plan to IDA | Due Date :30-Apr-2012
Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, G-1(b) | Description :Adopt Financial Restructuring Plan. | Due Date :28-Dec-2012
Finance Agreement :Sch2;Section I, I | Description :Submit Urban Water Sector Reform Plan to IDA and adopt within 6 months. | DueDate :30-Jun-2013

Preparation of water sanitation strategies and programm
Operating cost coverage ratio in utilities targeted by the project
Submission of previous years' audit reports to clients by May 15 of following year (yes/no)
Services contract is bid, signed and under implementation
Water production capacity installed under the project
Number of people in urban areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project
Number of staff/1000 active connections (after severance plan)
Proportion of volumes owed by "Instances Officielles" in total volumes owed
Proportion of bills owed by "Instances Officielles" in total billing
Rate of inactive connections per city
Rate of labor costs versus operational costs
Bill collection rate from private connections

Citizen engagement satisfactory complaints resolution by REGIDESO
